result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan James Piper

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 28, 2022 at 08:15 am.

8:10 a.m.  Court calls case.  Judge McKnight appears from Ashland County with CR.  Defendant Nathan James Piper appeared by video.  Attorney Kenneth W. Ryder III appeared by video for Nathan James Piper.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew J Tingstad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Per Atty Ryder, complaint has been received and def pleads NG.  Case to be set for STC on 11/28 at 8:15 a.m.  Parties can appear via Zoom.  Adj.  8:12 a.m.  klr
Arraignment on August 29, 2022 at 08:00 am.

8:01 a.m.  Court calls case, cites appearances. Judge and CR appear from Ashland County via Zoom.  Def's atty appears via Zoom.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI in Iron County.  Case scheduled for prelim today.  Per Atty Ryder, def is going to waive prelim.  Court explains purpose of prelim to def.  Def understands, and waives prelim.  Court accepts waiver of prelim, binds def over for trial.  Info to be filed today, and ARGN to be set for 8/29 at 8:00 a.m.  Adj.  8:10 a.m.  klr
Preliminary hearing on July 25, 2022 at 08:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 8:15 a.m.  INITIAL APPEARANCE:  Defendant Nathan James Piper appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Matthew J Tingstad appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Comp has been rcvd by def.  Def waives time limits for prelim.  Court explains purpose of prelim.  Def agrees with waiver of time limits.  Court finds def knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waives time limits.  Prelim set for 7/25 at 8:00 a.m.  Parties can appear via Zoom.  Bond continued.  Adj.  8:19 a.m.  klr
Status conference on June 27, 2022 at 08:15 am.

09:32 AM Defendant Nathan James Piper appeared by Zoom video means. Prosecuting Atty Matthew J Tingstad appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Mail was returned.  1106 Briggs Ave, Eau Claire, 54703.  Court inquires as to status of atty.  Def hired Billy Ryder from Ashland.  Def spoke with atty last week.  Will be meeting with atty today.  AIA to be rescheduled for 4/18 at 9:00 a.m.  Adj.  9:34 a.m.  klr
Notice of hrg enclosed for 4/11/22
Adjourned initial appearance on April 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:13 AM Defendant Nathan James Piper in court.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Court provides background.  Doesn't qualify for PD.  Has been in contact with an atty.  Court goes through charges.  AIA set for 4/11 at 9:00 a.m.  Adj.  9:15 a.m.  klr  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

03/01/2022 PC/Bond hearing minutes:  Def appears in person, in custody.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  PC statement given to Court.  Doc is not notarized, but officer here.  Public def info given to def and right to atty explained.  Def understands.  10:28 a.m.  Justin Colassacco sworn in, direct by DA.  Def identified by Officer.  Court questions Officer.  Court finds PC of Poss/Intent Deliver & OWI.  DA requests $2,000 cash bond.  States reason for Court.  Ongoing investigation, not local.  Def addresses Court.  Def lives at 412 Sunday Lake St., Wakefield.  Owned bldg/5 years.  Family is eau Claire.  Owns a construction business.  Further discussions held.  Def asks when can get vehile back.  Court sets $5,000 signature bond with $500 cash to be posted first.  Prohibitions include no possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription, no alcohol, no THC.  Initial will be on 3/14 at 9:00 a.m.  Def advised to contact public def.  Adj.  10:39 a.m.  klr
Bifurcated with $4500 sig component.

Def addresses Court.  Def lives at 412 Sunday Lake St., Wakefield.  Owned bldg/5 years.  Family is eau Claire.  Owns a construction business.  Further discussions held.
